item.title: BASH BASICS
item.description: Bash, or the Bourne-Again SHell, is named after the creator of the Unix shell Stephen Bourn. Bash is a command language interpreter that can execute commands and process text files as input. Shell scripts are, basically, files containing a series of commands. You can schedule Bash scripts to run at certain times to automate tasks for you. If you are using a Linux machine, you can write and execute Bash scripts in terminal.
